paragraphs.content: Chapter 12
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 12

paragraphs.content: And Job answered and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Job answered and said,

paragraphs.content: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

paragraphs.content: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

paragraphs.content: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.

paragraphs.content: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

paragraphs.content: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.

paragraphs.content: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
paragraphs.contentHtml: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

paragraphs.content: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the Lord hath wrought this?

paragraphs.content: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

paragraphs.content: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?

paragraphs.content: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

paragraphs.content: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

paragraphs.content: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.

paragraphs.content: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

paragraphs.content: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.

paragraphs.content: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

paragraphs.content: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

paragraphs.content: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

paragraphs.content: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.

paragraphs.content: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

paragraphs.content: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

paragraphs.content: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.

paragraphs.content: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

paragraphs.content: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
